sentences.en: ‘I was with Don,’ she said, deciding to bluff it out (=  continue to pretend something  ) .
sentences.cn: 她决定装到底，就说:“我是和唐在一起。”

sentences.en: " We don't want to listen to your bluff!
sentences.cn: “ 不要听你的狗屁!

sentences.en: He could bluff his way through any difficulty.
sentences.cn: 他可以招摇撞骗闯过任何难关.

sentences.en: He has a bluff way of speaking, but a kind heart.
sentences.cn: 他说话直率, 但心地善良.

sentences.en: He has continued to write with a bluff, vivid humour about Yorkshire life.
sentences.cn: 他继续用一种直白而又诙谐生动的笔触描绘着约克郡的生活。

sentences.en: He is kind and friendly despite his rather bluff manner.
sentences.cn: 他为人厚道,待人亲切,虽然态度有点粗鲁.

sentences.en: His bluff exterior belied a connoisseur of antiques.
sentences.cn: 他作风粗放,令人看不出他是古董鉴赏家.

sentences.en: It is not easy to climb a bluff mountain.
sentences.cn: 登上陡峭的山可不容易.

sentences.en: It was all up with the bluff about money and investment.
sentences.cn: 现在他再也不能说什么有钱、有投资的骗人鬼话了.

sentences.en: It was answered from under the bluff.
sentences.cn: 悬崖下立即有人回应.

sentences.en: One of the choppers set down on the beach below them, the other on the bluff above.
sentences.cn: 有一架直升机在他们下面的海滩上降落，其余的直接降落在断崖上。

sentences.en: That is impossible; so it must be just a bluff.
sentences.cn: 那是不可能的, 所以肯定不过是虚张声势.

sentences.en: The letter was a bluff.
sentences.cn: 这封信不过是吓唬人罢了。

sentences.en: The threat was only a bluff.
sentences.cn: 这种威胁不过是吓唬人而已。

sentences.en: They suspected this was a double bluff on the part of Cairo Intelligence.
sentences.cn: 他们怀疑这是开罗情报人员玩的空城计。

sentences.en: Wade was a hearty, bluff, athletic sort of guy.
sentences.cn: 韦德是个精力充沛、率直、运动型的人。

sentences.en: What we're at here is a game of bluff.
sentences.cn: 我们此时陷入的是一场骗局。

sentences.en: Whatever you say, you must do it. This isn’t a game of bluff .
sentences.cn: 不管你说什么，你一定得去做，这可不是在唬人。

sentences.en: With such a poor hand, I couldn't afford to call his bluff.
sentences.cn: 我手的牌太差了, 没能要他摊牌.

sentences.en: You wouldn’t really tell her. You’re bluffing!
sentences.cn: 你不会真的告诉她吧，你在吓唬我！

words.tran_cn: 陡峭地；船头扁平地；率直地；粗率地
吓唬人的人；用假像骗人的人

phrases.tran_cn: 伪装而得以幸免；蒙混过关
戳穿某人的幌子，揭穿某人的谎言

trans.tran_en: a bluff person, usually a man, is pleasant but very direct and does not always consider other people
an attempt to deceive someone by making them think you will do something, when you do not intend to do it
to pretend something, especially in order to achieve what you want in a difficult or dangerous situation
